title: [Large-Scale] Advanced Secondary Mathematics Curriculum Based on Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary-level mathematical fundamentals (equations, functions, geometry, statistics)
context.additional_context: Emphasizing practical competencies through project-based assessment for learners adapted to non-face-to-face environments post-COVID

learning_goals: Using flipped learning content (videos/interactive quizzes), over 80% of learners achieve weekly pre-learning objectives.
Through problem-solving activities based on experiential learning theory, learners independently solve over 70% of complex mathematical problems (function optimization, statistical inference).

Learners can design a math modeling project reflecting real-world job scenarios (e.g., construction site budgeting, manufacturing process optimization) in four-person teams, finalize reports incorporating peer collaborative learning (weekly peer reviews) and instructor feedback (three times at two-week intervals), and receive a score of 3.5 or higher on a 5-point scale for applicability from a field expert evaluation panel.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
